revised_title: The Break-up of Laminar Liquid Jets: Effect of Initial Velocity Profile
tldr: This study investigates the effect of initial velocity profiles on the stability of laminar liquid jets. Experiments with water jets discharging into air show that a parabolic axial velocity profile is more stable than a nearly uniform profile. The results support the idea that the initial velocity distribution plays a significant role in jet instability and can affect the contiguous length of the water stream.
